Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    bishop, king, knight, pawn, queen, rook

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Rikveet singh hayer This class is an abstract class for pieces It stores and performs the basic functions that every piece must do

    • Method Detail

      • getPossiblePositions

        public java.util.Set<Position> getPossiblePositions(Piece[][] board)
        Returns all the possible locations a piece can go to on the given board.
        Parameters:
        board - This is the chess board. In which the piece exists.
        Returns:
        the function returns the set of possible x,y values that the piece can go to.

      • highlight

        public void highlight(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane highlight,
                      int ci,
                      int cj,
                      int ni,
                      int nj)
        This method highlight a single square. Where the piece can go to.
        Parameters:
        highlight - Highlighted squares(Gui Grid).
        ci - current ith location on the Piece[][] board.
        cj - current jth location on the Piece[][] board.
        ni - new ith location.
        nj - new jth location.

      • highlightPossiblePositions

        public void highlightPossiblePositions(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane highlight,
                                       Piece[][] board)
        This method highlights all possible positions a piece can go to.
        Parameters:
        highlight - Highlighted squares(Gui Grid).
        board - the board to highlight for.

      • highlightSavingPositions

        public void highlightSavingPositions(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane highlight)
        This method is only executed when the relative king is in check and this piece move to save it.
        Parameters:
        highlight - Highlighted squares(Gui Grid).

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(int i,
                       int j,
                       Piece[][] board)
        Checks if a move is valid. If there is no friendly piece on the new location.
        Parameters:
        i - New i location on the board
        j - New j location on the board
        board - new location
        Returns:
        true if valid.

      • isCheck

        public boolean isCheck(int x,
                       int y,
                       Piece[][] board)
        This method is specifically for the king piece which returns true if any enemy pieces on the board can attack it.
        Parameters:
        x - x location to check on.
        y - y location to check on.
        board - the main board.
        Returns:
        returns true if the king is in check state.
